speaker: Outstanding Guest Actor in a Comedy Series
text: Woody Harrelson  * * *  ## Transcript {john masson}    _Act One Scene One - KACL, Frasier's show. Audrey has called in._

speaker: Audrey
text: [_v.o._] So, Dr Crane, I don't see why I should fix the dumb dress when my sister can't even fit into it anymore.
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Guest Actor in a Comedy Series

speaker: Frasier
text: Audrey, you borrowed the dress, you tore it.  As an old Greek haberdasher once said: "Euripedes, Eumenides." [_laughs_]

speaker: Audrey
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's just a little joke on the ancient dramatist Euripedes and the mythological Furies.

speaker: Audrey
text: Huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just fix the dress. [_line off_] We'll be back after the weather.

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh Roz, Noel gave me this to give to you.

speaker: Roz
text: [_taking gift_] Oh God, Noel.  He's been acting so weird lately.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lately?  May I remind you this is the man required by law to stay at least 100 yards away from William Shatner?

speaker: Roz
text: No, I bumped into him at Nervosa about a month ago, there were no other free tables so we sat together and ever since then he's been acting like we're some kind of a couple.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh come on, Roz.  I'm sure he knows that you're not interested in him.

speaker: Roz
text: [_showing Frasier the gift tag_] "Happy Monthaversary."

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Lord. [_Roz goes back to her booth_] We're on. [_on air_] And we're back, let's get straight to the phones.  I'm listening.

speaker: Woody
text: [_v.o._] Dr Crane?  It's Woody.  I'm in Seattle and I'm a little lost.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well Woody, in today's fast-paced, high-pressure society that's not uncommon.  Just why exactly do you feel lost?

speaker: Woody
text: Well, I've been driving around for about an hour, I can't seem to get out of the airport.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_the penny drops_] Oh, _Woody_ Woody.  Oh well, listeners, this is an old friend of mine from back in Boston.  Well, how you doin' there, you old cowpoke?

speaker: Woody
text: I was doing okay, but all this talk about today's fast-paced, high-pressure world's starting to get me down.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well I have just the cure for that.  How about dinner?

speaker: Woody
text: Sounds great.  I'm in town all week.

speaker: Frasier
text: And I'm free all week.  How's tonight?

speaker: Woody
text: That'd be great.  So I hear you're on the radio?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes I am, Woody.  And so are you.

speaker: Woody
text: No, no, no.  I'm still tending bar at Cheers.  How do these rumors get started?

speaker: Frasier
text: Believe it or not, listeners, Woody and I are picking up right where we left off. _While Frasier gets on with the show, Noel Shempsky comes into Roz's booth._

speaker: Noel
text: Knock knock?

speaker: Roz
text: Noel...

speaker: Noel
text: Oh, I haven't seen that outfit before, set your phasers on stunning.

speaker: Roz
text: Listen, I need to talk to you.  I can not accept anniversary gifts.

speaker: Noel
text: Oh, I know that.  I was just making a little joke.  I know we're just friends.  I saw this and it made me think of you.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay.  Thanks.

speaker: Noel
text: [_as he leaves_] Oh, if you're not going to open it for a while, you might want to move the the ribbon.  It's blocking the air holes.  _Roz very quickly puts the box down.  FADE OUT  Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. Martin is at the table looking at Eddie, who is sitting on The Chair with his head resting on the side table.  Daphne enters from the kitchen._

speaker: Daphne
text: Here.  I made you some lamb stew.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm telling you, there's something weird about Eddie.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, for the love of God, not this again.

speaker: Martin
text: You never should have taken him to those dog groomers.

speaker: Daphne
text: I had to bring him.  His toenails were like Howard Hughes's and his breath smelled like an autopsy.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, look at him.  They did something to him.  The sparkle's gone from his eyes.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, and so are those gooey green bits.  _Frasier enters from the bedroom as the front door bing-bongs. He's dressed in sweatshirt and jeans._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  That's probably Woody.  I'll get it. [_opens door_] Oh, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: [_entering_] Hello, Frasier.  I know this is impromptu, but I'm going to an oboe recital and I thought you might want to join me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm sorry, Niles.  An old friend of mine came in from out of town, I invited him to come over this evening.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, have him join us.  I'm sure we can get three seats together.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah well, I'm not sure an oboe recital's what I had in mind, I was thinking of something a little more raucous.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, if it's raucous you're looking for, we could go and get a nightcap at the piano bar at the Mayflower Hotel - It's Jerome Kern night!  Last time people were shouting out requests without raising their hands!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I'm afraid we'll have to pass.  You see, my friend Woody is an old bar chum from back at Cheers. [_the doorbell bing bongs.  Frasier goes to answer it_] What I had in mind was really more of a beer-swillin', back-slappin' kind of night, if you know what I mean?  You're certainly welcome to join us if you like.

speaker: Niles
text: It sounds interesting.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right. [_opens door to -_] Woody?

speaker: Woody
text: Hey, Dr Crane! [_they hug_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Good to see ya.

speaker: Woody
text: You look great.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well thank you, thanks.  You too.

speaker: Woody
text: Aah, this place is awesome.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Woody
text: [_indicating Daphne, Martin and Niles_] I'm not surprised you need all these roommates to help you pay for it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Er, they're not really roommates, Woody.  They're... they're more like boarders actually.  That's my father, Martin.

speaker: Woody
text: Well, hi.  I remember hearing about you, you were a policeman, right?

speaker: Martin
text: That's right.

speaker: Frasier
text: And that's my brother right there, Niles.  He's a psychiatrist too.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Woody
text: Oh, wow!

speaker: Frasier
text: And this is Daphne Moon, my father's home health-care worker.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's nice to meet you.

speaker: Woody
text: Oh hi.  I like your accent.  Aah, you're from England, right?

speaker: Daphne
text: Manchester.

speaker: Woody
text: Darn!  I'm usually pretty good at that. [_Eddie bounces in_] Oh hey, who's this little guy?

speaker: Martin
text: I'm not sure I even know anymore.

speaker: Woody
text: [_to Frasier, confidentially_] My dad's getting the same way.

speaker: Frasier
text: So Woody, can I get you a beer?

speaker: Woody
text: That's funny, huh? Y'know, all those years I was waiting on you, and now you're getting me a beer.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes well, life's like that sometimes, isn't it?  Daphne, get us a couple of beers, will ya? [_Daphne goes to kitchen, not happily_] So, what brings you to Seattle?

speaker: Woody
text: My cousin's getting married.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Niles
text: Which is your cousin, the bride or the groom?

speaker: Woody
text: Actually, both are.

speaker: Niles
text: I assume they're kissing cousins?

speaker: Woody
text: Ho, they're doing a lot more than that!  That's why they have to get married.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, is Kelly with you?

speaker: Woody
text: No no, she's visiting her mom with the kids, but she sends her love.

speaker: Frasier
text: And how's the old gang?

speaker: Woody
text: Oh well, they haven't changed much.  Sam's doing great, Carla's terrific... oh, y'know, we almost had a wedding.  Mr. Clavin got himself one of those Eastern European mail-order brides, but ah, they lived together for a couple of days, and decided to call it off.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, gosh.  I'm so sorry for Cliff.

speaker: Woody
text: Yeah.  She said she was homesick.  That Bosnia must be a beautiful place.  [__N.B. Woody Harrelson appeared in the film, "Welcome to Sarajevo."__]

speaker: Daphne
text: Here we are.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh thank you, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: That's one for you, one for you, and [_opens can and heads towards Martin. Sits down_] one for me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well Woody, I thought tonight we would just maybe stay in, y'know, order some pizza?

speaker: Woody
text: Sounds good by me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, great.  I'll just call the place around the corner. Niles you uh, gonna join us?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, why not?  It'll be fun to drink some beer and have some pizza with a couple of rapscallions.

speaker: Woody
text: Oh hey, if you don't mind, could we make that half rapscallions, half pepperoni? _FADE TO:  Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment, later that night. Frasier and Woody are reminiscing, moderately drunk, and can barely speak for laughing._

speaker: Woody
text: That wasn't the best prank we played.  You remember that time with Mr. Clavin?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes.  And the ferret! [_more laughter; Daphne and Martin look on, obviously not understanding._]

speaker: Woody
text: [_explaining_] He was about to go on his round and we shoved an angry ferret into his mailbag.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, my.  Exactly, ahh, how do you make a ferret angry?

speaker: Woody
text: Well, for starters, you shove him into a mailbag.

speaker: Frasier
text: God, that was funny.  Do you remember the expression on his face?

speaker: Woody
text: Y'know, I never saw his face.  I was too busy looking at Mr. Clavin.

speaker: Frasier
text: Woody, let me get you another cold one.

speaker: Woody
text: Oh, thanks.

speaker: Frasier
text: My god.  I tell ya, this has just been the best evening.  My God, it's like re-living all my old days at Cheers, only without Lilith.  Boy, that's a trip to Bountiful, let me tell ya. [_goes into kitchen_]

speaker: Martin
text: [_quietly, to Daphne_] These guys are really getting through the beers, aren't they?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, yes.  If this keeps up, you may have to fish out that emergency can you keep in the toilet tank.

speaker: Frasier
text: There you are, Woods.

speaker: Woody
text: Well, y'know what, on second thought I think I'm gonna pass. I'm feeling a little bit jet-lagged.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all right, you want to call it a night?

speaker: Woody
text: You know, I probably should.  But this was so much fun.  I'd really like to do it again.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all right, how about lunch tomorrow?

speaker: Woody
text: Oh yeah, that sounds great.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay.

speaker: Woody
text: Hey, goodbye y'all, nice to meet you.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh hey, you too.  Come back.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know what, Woody?  There's a new gourmet Mexican restaurant over near your hotel I'd love to try.  It's called "Dos Burros." It sounds _muy delicioso_.

speaker: Woody
text: I didn't know you speak Spanish?

speaker: Frasier
text: Ohh, it's nothing.

speaker: Woody
text: I know ahh, "dos" means two, what does "burro" mean?

speaker: Frasier
text: Same as in English, Jackass.

speaker: Woody
text: [_leaves_] Sorry, just asking. **THE LONG GOODBYE**  _Scene Four - Frasier's Apartment, next day. He and Woody are back from lunch._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey guys, how was lunch?

speaker: Woody
text: Oh, great.  We told one old story, we told a hundred. [_to Eddie_] Hey, how you doin', little guy?

speaker: Martin
text: His name's Eddie.

speaker: Woody
text: Hey, good for you, Mr Crane. [_to Frasier, confidentially_] They have good days, and they have bad days.

speaker: Frasier
text: Woody, here's that Seattle guidebook I was telling you about, right here.

speaker: Woody
text: Oh, thanks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Take a loan of that, huh?

speaker: Woody
text: [_looking at picture in book_] Wow, look at that view, you can see the whole city.

speaker: Frasier
text: Woody, turn around, it's even better.

speaker: Woody
text: Gosh.  You're right, this is better.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no Woody, look up.

speaker: Woody
text: [_finally seeing the panorama outside the window_] OHH. [_indicating balcony_] You mind if I go out there?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no.  You go ahead.

speaker: Woody
text: Remember the time we went out on the balcony of Melville's and threw pudding?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughing_] I don't think I laughed harder in my entire life!  _Woody goes onto the balcony.  Frasier goes into the kitchen. The laughter stops._

speaker: Frasier
text: Put a bullet in my head.

speaker: Martin
text: What's going on?

speaker: Frasier
text: My God.  I have absolutely nothing in common with this man, except things that happened ten years ago.

speaker: Martin
text: But I thought you had a fun time last night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh well, yes.  We had exactly the same time this afternoon, it wasn't nearly as fun.  The same stories, and variations thereof, being forced to laugh over and over.  I swear, if I never get another shoulder noogie I will die a happy man.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, don't feel bad.  You've been a good friend and you've shown him a nice time, and now all that's left is for you to go in there and tell him goodbye.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I guess when all this is over I'll have learned a valuable lesson.  Sometimes you can have too much of a good thing.  You have to know when to say "When."  The past is just that, the past.  You can never go home again.  Less is more.

speaker: Martin
text: Wish you had started with that last one.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_goes into lounge area, where Woody is sitting_] Well, Woods? It's been great seeing you.

speaker: Woody
text: Oh yeah, hey.

speaker: Frasier
text: C'mon, gimme a good hug, ah? [_they hug_] Now you gotta promise me you're gonna give my love to everybody back at the bar.

speaker: Woody
text: Oh, I will.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, and give that beautiful wife of yours and those two kids a kiss from Uncle Frasier.

speaker: Woody
text: You got it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now don't be a stranger, okay?

speaker: Woody
text: No, I won't, I won't. [_they hug again_] So, [_sitting down_] where are we going for dinner tonight?  _End of Act One.  Act Two.  Scene Five -- Cafe Nervosa. Frasier enters and meets Niles._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier.  Odd to see you without Woody in tow.  He off teasing ferrets?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, listen, uh, I've been having such a great time with Woody, I was wondering, y'know, maybe tonight you'd like to join us?  We've planned to go out...

speaker: Niles
text: [_interrupting_] You can save it.  Dad brought me up to speed with your reunion of the damned.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, God.

speaker: Niles
text: I would love to help, I'm sorry, you're on your own.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, please, Niles, really, I'm desperate.  Do you have any idea how difficult it is to feign interest in the same old stories over and over again?

speaker: Niles
text: And you call yourself a psychiatrist?  You wouldn't last a week in private practice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ooh.

speaker: Niles
text: Speaking of which, my six o'clock is waiting.

speaker: Waiter
text: [_handing Niles a coffee carton_] Triple espresso to go.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you. [_leaves_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles?  Please?  Please, I need you.  It's going to be an excruciating journey into... Ohh... [_notices Roz is standing beside him_] Roz!  Hey, you know what, are you up for a night on the town?

speaker: Roz
text: This wouldn't be the invitation that Niles just blew off, would it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right!  Here, please. [_they sit_] My old friend Woody is dragging me out again tonight.  I could really use a buffer. He's taking me to some God-awful karaoke bar.

speaker: Roz
text: Are you gonna sing?

speaker: Frasier
text: No!

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, I'll go.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really, you will?

speaker: Roz
text: I had a babysitter tonight, my plans fell through, karaoke might be fun.

speaker: Gil
text: Karaoke?  Tonight?  Oh, I'd love to.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well Gil, I'm not sure you'd enjoy this.

speaker: Gil
text: Oh nonsense.  If we're going to the one on Pike, I keep a locker there where I store my own microphone and show jackets.  [_N.B. Notice Edward Hibbert's tan; he has just returned from shooting the pilot for the short-lived remake of "Fantasy Island."_]

speaker: Noel
text: Hey, guys.  Hi, Roz.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Noel.

speaker: Noel
text: [_to Roz_] I see you're at... our table.

speaker: Gil
text: "Our table"?  Ooh, is there an office romance brewing?

speaker: Roz
text: No, Gil.  We're just friends, right Noel?

speaker: Noel
text: [_fingers crossed_] So far.

speaker: Gil
text: [_to Noel_] Well, who knows what the night has in store? We're all going for karaoke.  Why don't you join us?

speaker: Noel
text: Count me in.

speaker: Roz
text: [_panicking_] Is that my beeper?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_knowing she's about to bail on him_] I didn't hear anything.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh my God!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: It's the babysitter, she only calls in an emergency.  I have to go, bye! [_she exits, quickly_] TAXI!!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, wait!

speaker: Noel
text: Roz, wait!

speaker: Gil
text: Well, looks as it's just us boys.  _Frasier tries to smile through the tears.  FADE TO:_  **CAPTAIN'S LOG, STARDATE 3012.4  MR. SPOCK INFORMS ME THERE IS NO KLINGON WORD FOR "FEEL"**  _Scene Six - Frasier's Apartment. Daphne, Martin and Niles have just finished watching a movie. Music is playing over the credits._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, that was beautiful.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.  You know Niles, that was the first movie I ever took your mother to see.  I deliberately picked a tear jerker so I'd be there to comfort her.  At the first sniffle, I was on her like an octopus.

speaker: Daphne
text: You men.  You always find a way to make us more vulnerable to your clumsy advances.  Ooh, that wine went straight to my head.

speaker: Niles
text: [_refilling her glass_] Let's kill off the bottle, shall we? [_he keeps on pouring until it's full to the brim_]

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: Turn off the music.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh.  Well, we were just...

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad.  I never want to hear music again.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh.  I take it you had a whizz-bang time at the karaoke bar?

speaker: Frasier
text: For starters, Woody sang "What Kind Of Fool Am I?"  Quickly turned into an audience participation number.  Then Gil and Noel did a charming duet with "Anything You Can Do, I Can Do Better."  They were both wrong.  I guess the highlight of the evening was when Gil, after one too many Que Royales, performed a haunting rendition of "I Feel Pretty," during the latter verses of which Noel joined him on the apron of the stage and translated... into Klingon. [_he buries his head in his hands_] Well, I think I'm just gonna go off to bed so I can get up bright and early for my harbour cruise with Woody tomorrow.

speaker: Martin
text: What?!  You're seeing him again?  Why don't you tell the guy you're busy for once?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, he knows that I'm not.  Besides, I'd hate to hurt his feelings, I'd hate to have him think I've outgrown him.

speaker: Niles
text: But you have.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's the problem.  I've moved on to bigger and better things in my life, he's still pouring drinks back in the same bar he's been at for the last fifteen years.  Don't you think that's kinda sad?

speaker: Martin
text: If I were you I'd just lie to him.  Tell him you have to work, or you met a pretty girl.  _Daphne, having almost worked her way through her full glass of wine, suddenly bursts into song._

speaker: Daphne
text: Who's that pretty girl in the mirror there? What mirror, where? Who could that attractive girl be? Which, what, where, who? Who?

speaker: Martin
text: Daphne?

speaker: Daphne
text: Who?

speaker: Martin
text: Daphne?

speaker: Daphne
text: Wh..

speaker: Frasier
text: _DAPHNE!!!_

speaker: Martin
text: Bedtime.

speaker: Daphne
text: I used to be with a light opera works.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, fine, and I used to be a fan dancer!  Get out.  Go to bed!   [__N.B. Daphne's song is from "West Side Story."__]

speaker: Niles
text: She uh, seems a little wobbly, [_moves to follow her_] perhaps I should...

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Ooh, surprise, guess who?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God!  I just left him.  What moonlit berry-picking expedition does he have planned for me now?

speaker: Niles
text: [_worried that Woody might hear him_] Shhh.

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't take this anymore.  All right, all right fine.  I'm just going to have to lie to him. [_opens door_] Woody!

speaker: Woody
text: Hey, Dr Crane.  Hey, everybody.  Listen, I... when I got back to my hotel I called Kelly to say goodnight, and uh... it turns out our little girl has an ear infection, so I'm taking the Redeye right now and my cab is waiting for me downstairs.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_concerned_] Oh well, Woody.  I guess this means goodbye, then.

speaker: Woody
text: Yeah, I'm afraid so.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right then, give me a hug.  You remember to give my love to the folks back at Cheers.

speaker: Woody
text: Oh, will do.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay.  I hope that little girl of yours gets better real soon.

speaker: Woody
text: Thank you.  It was great spending time with you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it was great seeing you too, Woody.

speaker: Woody
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's a shame we have to cut it short.

speaker: Woody
text: It sure is.  Well, goodbye. [_leaves as the others say farewell_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Goodbye, Wood. [_closes door_] God bless the virus that invaded that little girl's ear canal.

speaker: Niles
text: Congratulations.  I'll be off.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh no.  Niles, I'll tell you what, to celebrate my newfound freedom, why don't we go over to that little cantina I mentioned to you earlier, and I'll buy you a late supper? We'll have a margarita.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: And after that, we'll go by that pricey new cigar club, it's my treat.

speaker: Niles
text: Well hey, big spender.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_cringing_] Ohh...

speaker: Niles
text: Is everything all right?

speaker: Frasier
text: The last time I heard that phrase, Gil was belting it out while sitting on the lap of a Japanese businessman.  Let's get that margarita. [_they leave_] _FADE TO:  Scene Seven - Dos Burros, a Mexican restaurant. Frasier and Niles have just been seated.  The waiter gives them their menus._

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: I think you'll like this place.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I do already.  N.M.B.

speaker: Frasier
text: N.M.B?

speaker: Niles
text: No Mariachi Band.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_seeing a certain someone seated at the bar_] Oh dear God. Quick, hide your face with your menu.  Woody's over there. If he sees us he'll know I lied.

speaker: Niles
text: When did you lie?

speaker: Frasier
text: I told him I was going out of town.

speaker: Niles
text: No, you didn't.  He told you he was going out of town.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's right.  He lied.  He should be hiding. [_calls_] Woody? Woody?

speaker: Frasier
text: For God's sake.  Stay here. [_he goes over to the restroom door only to find it locked_] Woody.  Come out of there, please.

speaker: Woody
text: [_from behind the door_] _No hablo ingles._

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't understand this.

speaker: Woody
text: It means I don't speak English.

speaker: Frasier
text: Will you just come out here? [_Woody comes out_] Woody?  What is going on?

speaker: Woody
text: I can't even look at you.  I'm so ashamed.  I... I lied to you, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why did you do that?

speaker: Woody
text: Well, I guess I didn't want you to know it was me in the bathroom.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Woody.  Earlier this evening you told me you were going back to Boston.

speaker: Woody
text: Oh, well.  I feel terrible saying this but, I just couldn't face another day of us hanging out together.

speaker: Frasier
text: What, you weren't enjoying our time together?

speaker: Woody
text: No, I... I had a great time that first night, but after that, I don't know, you were still having a good time, but ahhh, it was less and less fun for me.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughing_] This is too funny.

speaker: Woody
text: See, you're still having a good time and I'm miserable.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why didn't you say something?

speaker: Woody
text: Well, I don't know, I didn't want to hurt your feelings. To tell you the truth, I felt kinda bad for ya.

speaker: Frasier
text: You felt bad for me?

speaker: Woody
text: Well no offense, but look at your life.  You live with your dad, you hang out with your brother, you have no plans.  And let's face it, those karaoke friends of yours, I wouldn't want to be stranded on a desert island with them.  Well, maybe that English guy, he's a good entertainer.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really Woody, there's nothing to worry about.  I know my life may seem rather dreary to you but ah, it's really quite enjoyable.  In fact, it's even a lot of fun.  I love my life now, honestly.  You know what, I wouldn't trade my years at Cheers for anything, but I am very happy with my life the way it is today.

speaker: Woody
text: [_incredulous_] You mean it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  That's what makes this conversation so ironic.  You see, you see my life as some sort of middle-aged compromise and, well just the other day I was thinking about your life.  And all I could think was...

speaker: Woody
text: What?  _Frasier pauses, knowing that telling Woody exactly what he thinks won't help anyone.  He then realizes another truth._

speaker: Frasier
text: How lucky you are.  You see, you've found where you belong and you've made your home there.  I guess for some of us it just takes longer than others.

speaker: Woody
text: [_relaxing_] I just stopped in for a beer...

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know what, Niles will be on the phone for a couple of more minutes, why don't we have one last drink together, huh?

speaker: Woody
text: That'd be nice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay.  Barkeep, a couple of beers here, please?

speaker: Woody
text: You know, I meant what I said.  I had a great time hanging out with you.  That first night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah.

speaker: Woody
text: Maybe we could do it again, in five or ten years.

speaker: Frasier
text: Absolutely.  Ten years it is.

speaker: Woody
text: Cheers.

speaker: Frasier
text: Cheers.
